lst.name: sentence
lst.str: And pin the fields of banking and insurance -- the very lifeblood of Switzerland's service sector -- Swiss interests could prove directly opposite to its EFTA partners with their pppppppnarrow and tightly protected financial markets.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The European Community wants to eliminate all obstacles to free movement of goods, services and people by 1992, a laudable goal that has sent shivers down the spines of its closest trading neighbours.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The plan is so extensive that even the EFTA countries -- Switzerland, Austria, Sweden, Norway, Finland and Iceland -- with decades of close trade ties, find it hard to adopt a joint position.
